main event: Residents of Hazard, Kentucky observed a bright metallic object that they believed was west of the sun.
interesting points: The object was observed for several weeks and appeared stationary relative to the sun., Dr. Hynek suggested that the object was probably Venus, which was approximately 30 degrees west of the sun., There was a suggestion that weather conditions could increase the apparent size of Venus during daylight., Major Quintanilla confirmed that observers thought it might be a planet., The residents planned to use telescopes to obtain photographs of the object.
witness description: Mr. Ernest and Mr. Quintanilla, who reported on behalf of residents and discussed the sighting with Dr. Hynek.
